summary: Playful interactive website to ask someone out for lunch (15 Feb 2026) using a 3-question, slide-based multiple-choice flow with conditional image slides and final visual effects based on the last answer.
architectural_notes: Implement slide/state machine navigation: Q1 -> (optional image slide if option 2) -> Q2 -> image slide (based on option) -> Q3 -> final message + visual effect based on option.
Provide reusable components for: question slide, image slide (text-on-image), and effect overlay (confetti/hearts/heartbroken).
Ensure EndScreen does not render any external builder credit/footer; keep end screen purely app-owned content.
Implement slide transitions via a consistent animation approach across the slide/state machine (e.g., shared transition wrapper for all slides).
known_issues: Footer/credit (‚ÄúBuilt with caffeine.ai‚Äù) is still visible on the deployed link; removal is pending and requires rebuild/redeploy after code change.

existing_features.title: Create a slide-based, mobile-friendly React UI that asks the user out for lunch on 15 February 2026 and guides them through the exact 3-question multiple-choice flow described, with smooth transitions between slides.

Implement Question 1 slide with the exact prompt and options, and branch to the correct next slide based on the selected option:
- Prompt: "Do you wanna know something?"
- Options: (1) "Yes" (2) "No im okay"
- If option (2) is selected, show an image slide that reads: "im gonna tell you anyways üòã" and then continue to Question 2.
- If option (1) is selected, go directly to Question 2.

Implement Question 2 slide with the exact prompt and 4 options, then show a dedicated image slide with the correct text based on the selected option, and after the image slide always continue to Question 3.
- Prompt: "Guess who is asking you  out for tommorows lunch?"
- Options: (1) "Someone random" (2) "Someone special" (3) "Someone ugly" (4) "Yuvi ofc"
- If (1): image text "That random someone is yuvi"
- If (2): image text "that speacial someone is yuvi"
- If (3): image text "that ugly someone is yuvi"
- If (4): image text "yesssssss ü•π"

Implement Question 3 slide with the exact prompt and 3 options, and display the specified final message and visual effects based on the selected option:
- Prompt: "Will you be my foodie foodie soul for tommorows lunch?"
- Options: (1) "Yess" (2) "Ofc yes" (3) "No"
- If (1): show text "letttsss goo" with a confetti effect.
- If (2): show text "yessss" with many floating 3D heart effects.
- If (3): show text "He is anyways gonna take you out" with heartbroken confetti and floating 3D heartbroken heart effects.
Generate and use static image assets for each required ‚Äòimage slide‚Äô message; store them in frontend/public/assets/generated and render them directly from the frontend (not via the backend).
Apply a cohesive, playful romantic visual theme across the whole site (colors, typography, layout, transitions) suitable for a lunch-invite flow; avoid a blue/purple-dominant palette.
Add basic UX controls: disable double-submission on option clicks, provide a clear way to restart the experience from the end screen, and ensure keyboard accessibility for options (tab/enter/space).
Remove the ‚ÄúBuilt with ‚Ä¶ using caffeine.ai‚Äù footer/credit from the final end screen so the site appears fully handmade.
